column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=And I , you know , am concerned about that because I love my five daughters and I want them to grow up with opportunity .
#Text=I want them to grow up in economic freedom and to be able to compete and do things and love and live and enjoy life and not have a country on the brink of collapse — of economic collapse .
#Text=So I 'm very outspoken on issues like that and on national security issues and also on Supreme Court nomination issues , and that sort of thing .
#Text=And because of that , that 's led to speculation .
#Text=When the speculation took place regarding Senator Lugar and also Congressman Burton , we did have brief discussions with my family , with my daughters , around our kitchen table .

#Text=Some of my daughters have been character actors , or youth interpreters I should say , at Conner Prairie , a live museum here in central Indiana , others have served as members of the Indianapolis Children 's Choir .
#Text=They 're all very involved in the home school community and their friends are here .

#Text=So I told them that if I ran and got elected to federal office , they would either have to move out to Washington D.C. , or they would n't get to see their dad three nights , at least three nights out of the week .
#Text=And once I gave them that information , they were unanimous in their opposition to me running for Congress or the United States Senate .
#Text=Until I get to a point where my family balance can be taken into consideration , I do n't anticipate seeking higher office .
#Text=But I 'm always humble and grateful that people consider my record and my views worthy of consideration for such purpose .
#Text=Tew : Just briefly , senator .
#Text=Your passage of the local government initiative that would allow governments to merge was very successful in your district , but not successful elsewhere around Indiana .
#Text=What was it about your district that made it unique in that it decided to merge ?
#Text=Well the reform that came from House Bill 1362 , which at the time was the most dramatic reform in Title 36 , in probably 25 years or more .
#Text=It allowed for the creation of a government of the people , by the people , for the people subject to the imagination .
#Text=Whatever the mind could come up with , you could do up to the county boundary .
#Text=And so in the case of Eagle and Union Townships deciding to dissolve themselves and then enter into a pact with the town of Zionsville and create the new town of Zionsville , it took vision .
#Text=It took selfless service because you had two township trustees that had to agree to dissolve their reason for being .
#Text=Not many elected officials will do something like that .
#Text=It was a very courageous move by the trustee of Eagle and the trustee of Union Townships to do that .

#Text=I think part of the problem that we 've had in other parts of the state , including Evansville and Fort Wayne , is that the process and the law has not been adequately marketed and explained to the public and to elected officials .
#Text=But right now in Indiana Code , you could reform local government up to the county boundary in just about any way imaginable to the mind .
#Text=The only thing that really is the constraint is the imagination .
